issue.title: Revise implementation of `RandomNumberExtension` in the User Guide

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Once #3437 is resolved, we should revise the implementation of the `RandomNumberExtension` to return it to its ideal form.

## Related Issues

- #3433
- #3437 

## Deliverables

- [ ] Effectively revert the last changes made to the `RandomNumberExtension` to _fix_ it for 5.10.1.

body:
Hi @Michael1993,

> Should I be able to inject a `@RegisterExtension` value with a field-level `TestInstancePostProcessor`?

Ideally, yes, I believe so. At least, generally speaking a `TestInstancePostProcessor` should be capable of doing that.

I believe I demonstrated that once with Spring. Let me see if I can find it...

> I believe I demonstrated that once with Spring. Let me see if I can find it...

https://stackoverflow.com/a/50251190/388980

> Also: can I work on this issue? Other than this one question, I think I can handle it.

Thanks for volunteering!

However, this issue is assigned to me and not labeled as `up-for-grabs`.

In addition, it may turn out to be more challenging than you expect.

In light of that, I would like to keep this assigned to me.

FWIW, I took a glance at your [spike](https://github.com/Michael1993/junit5/commit/bb00173c2ca617eb4ff60a588bfc44b9b07115e5), and I'd like to point out that we have no plans to add specific handling for a particular extension API (such as `TestInstancePostProcessor`). Rather, I will implement a general solution that applies to any extension type registered via `@ExtendWith` on both static and non-static fields, and I've already begun work on this issue.
Sorry, I don't know how I missed that. I will take a look at the up-for-grabs issues instead, then. 🙂
